intro: Thiebautia nervosa, commonly known as the veined thiebautia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its palmate leaves with prominent veins. The plant produces showy, pink to red flowers that bloom in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Thiebautia nervosa is often found in moist, well-drained soils in woodland or savanna habitats. Its botanical features make it a notable ornamental plant in horticulture.
